comment: Well china is also an atheist majority country, they condemn religion, you aren't allowed to become a government officials if you follow a religion. I'm up for it, but are you
amr:
# ::snt Well china is also an atheist majority country, they condemn religion, you aren't allowed to become a government officials if you follow a religion. I'm up for it, but are you
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (c / country
            :mod (a / atheist)
            :mod (m2 / majority)
            :domain (c2 / country
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "China"))
            :mod (a2 / also))
      :snt2 (c3 / condemn-01
            :ARG0 (t / they)
            :ARG1 (r / religion))
      :snt3 (a3 / allow-01
            :polarity -
            :ARG1 (b / become-01
                  :ARG1 (y / you)
                  :ARG2 (p / person
                        :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91
                              :ARG1 (g / government-organization
                                    :ARG0-of (g2 / govern-01))
                              :ARG2 (o / official)))
                  :condition (f / follow-02
                        :ARG0 y
                        :ARG1 (r2 / religion))))
      :snt4 (c4 / contrast-01
            :ARG1 (u / up-03
                  :ARG1 (ii / i)
                  :ARG2 (ii2 / it))
            :ARG2 y))
